statement: Energy Transfer LP (ET) has signed a 20-year agreement with Chevron to supply 2.0 million tonnes of LNG per annum from its Lake Charles LNG project. The deal brings the facility closer to a final investment decision (FID) and enhances ET's LNG export capabilities. Under the agreement, the LNG will be supplied on a free-on-board (FOB) basis, with a purchase price consisting of a fixed liquefaction charge and a gas supply component indexed to the Henry Hub benchmark. The deal is a significant step forward for ET's efforts to meet growing demand for clean energy and is part of its strategy to diversify its midstream energy assets.
introduction: Energy Transfer LP (ET) has signed a 20-year agreement with Chevron to supply 2.0 million tonnes of LNG per annum from its Lake Charles LNG project, bringing the facility closer to a final investment decision.

introduction: TeraWulf will provide 70 MW of data center infrastructure to Core42 for GPU clusters featuring Dell Integrated Rack Scalable Solutions.

Hill, who returned to Nike after a stint away, has acknowledged that the brand has lost its focus on sport and is competing with its partners, and is pledging to fix relationships with retailers like Foot Locker and JD Sports. Despite this, Nike has extended its partnership with the NFL through 2038 and is introducing new products, such as Air Max 95, to compete with rival brands offering more comfortable and cushioned shoes.

statement: Bitcoin, a decentralized cryptocurrency, was created in 2008 by an anonymous person known as Satoshi Nakamoto.
